channel.title: #moparcraft-staff
channel.description:
In my quest to ever promote continual staff discussion, and new ideas I'd like to remind the staff time about our own channel. We don't just have #moparcraft we also have #moparcraft-staff which is for the staff of the MC community. I'm always there, and so is Moparisthebest (While mainly AFK) and Zuppers.
I cannot stress how important the above is, which brings me onto my next topic, I've been trying to speak to you all personally for a month or so now just to make sure we're all on the same page I'm aware some staff werent happy with a few things, and said others agree so I'd like to have a time where we can all meet up on the IRC.
I'm aware of the time of year, and that we all have responsibilities, so I'm going to leave it up to the people attending to decide when the meeting should be and what time. Please take responsibility for this, and don't make me put down a time again. I'm giving you control over this meeting, so if you don't take responsibility and nobody turns up I'll make the decisions by holding a meeting with myself.

item.title: #moparcraft-staff
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:14, topic:467145”]Unfortunately due to me working 11/14 days per fortnight it leaves me with little time to be on the computer. If i was to choose a time slot that i could fit in it would be inconvenient for the rest of you since its constantly changing and i’m aware that you all have school, work and for our american friends, sleep.

If you want to choose a definite time i’ll do my best to be there but in the chance i can’t make it, can someone note down the irc conversation and send it to me and i’ll give my input to everyone individually[/quote]
Sure, the meeting will be at 11pm GMT on Saturday

Read full topic

item.title: #moparcraft-staff
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Okay that’s good, if you could also suggest a date and such that would be even better

I don’t want to make a new topic but I’d like to bring in a concept for the new SSP, which hopefully should be happening soon. I posted a similar idea on MSCP, and would like to potentially see it as a thing for both status pages (Though I’m still waiting for Moparisthebest to take a look). I’ll quote:

[quote=“Tom, post:1, topic:466394”]Alternately, in an attempt to provide a wider range of pathways the approach could be taken to try and allow other well performing servers to take the next step up, and give them a chance to purchase sponsored in the future. This could come in the form of a silver server, the one between normal and sponsored. A generically priced spot, with no limit to show the more serious servers. Nothing fancy but it seperates the “I’m 12 and what is this” servers which die and fail within 24 hours from the somewhat serious ones which have potential. I think this is important simply because the normal servers are now fighting for less traffic, which of course induces harsher advertising simply because there is less to go around, I like to think of it as directing the traffic to servers that suggest more longevity. Though of course this isn’t tested, I haven’t suggested a price or anything for that matter if it were to be $5 then it wouldn’t suggest much personally. I suspect this route won’t be popular, but if it is things like that are all a matter of perspective for a later date. Of course there are what people view as ethical issues behind the above idea, in the fact you’re further “taking away” the spirit of RSPS.

I’m still quite skeptical on the ideas, and they’re by no means my own final result.[/quote]

I haven’t just forgotten about MoparCraft or anything, I have what I believe is a reasonable plan to get things back to where they should be. Hopefully in the future it will fall into place with what I’m doing at the moment.

Don’t worry, no map resets either

Read full topic
